title: Restore Hero background asset and update AVAIL — The Nexus Effect card media

requirements.summary: Restore the original Hero background image content while keeping the existing /assets/1.png src reference unchanged.
acceptanceCriteria: HeroSection background image renders as it did before the mistaken swap (i.e., not the user-provided AVAIL image).

The Hero section still uses the same src path currently referenced in code (frontend/src/components/sections/HeroSection.tsx), but the underlying asset content is restored to the original hero background.

file_operations.description: Replace the current (incorrect) Hero background image file content with the original Hero background image content, keeping the filename and public path unchanged so HeroSection continues to reference /assets/1.png.

requirements.summary: Update only the “AVAIL — The Nexus Effect” card to show the user-provided image instead of the current X embed/preview, leaving all other cards unchanged.
acceptanceCriteria: The “AVAIL — The Nexus Effect” card in frontend/src/components/sections/SelectedSignalsSection.tsx displays the user-provided image.
The user-provided image does not appear as the Hero background.
Other Selected Signals cards continue to behave as they did before (no unintended image changes).

file_operations.description: Update the signals data/rendering so only the “AVAIL — The Nexus Effect” card shows a static image (from /assets/...) in place of the XPostEmbed/preview; keep other cards’ embed/preview behavior unchanged. Optionally compose the existing ImageOpenInNewTab component for the image presentation (do not modify any files under frontend/src/components/ui). Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

requirements.summary: Add the user-provided AVAIL image as a static public asset and reference it from the AVAIL card via an absolute /assets/... path.
acceptanceCriteria: The user-provided image is stored under frontend/public/assets/ (or a subfolder) and is referenced via an absolute public path (e.g., /assets/...).
No backend changes are required to serve or fetch the image.

file_operations.description: Add the user-provided image as a static public asset at frontend/public/assets/generated/avail-nexus-effect.dim_1600x900.png so it can be referenced via an absolute /assets/... public path.

Reference the new static asset (frontend/public/assets/generated/avail-nexus-effect.dim_1600x900.png) from the “AVAIL — The Nexus Effect” card using an absolute public path, ensuring no backend fetch/storage is introduced and no other section uses this image.
